Soymour* No# 565, my 19th, 1945* D« R. 5.50 p.m. May 19th, 1943. 5.15 a.m. May 20th, 1943. %SkA \ * yyyy Your to1 q gram No. 466. Govermiont of India have stated that they do not v/ish to ask Mackenzie Stevens to break his journey for consultation with them but he has boon invited by Government of Burma to visit Sraila* 2. Ho will fly to Calcutta early in June where he will contact China Relations Office before proceeding to Simla.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 4; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file consists of two telegrams between the Foreign Office, the Government of India, and HM Chungking regarding the movements of Mackenzie Stevens.
